list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He tightened a few slack screws.
He is very slack about getting things done.

list_definition.definition: in industry etc, not busy; inactive

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Business has been rather slack lately.

list_ex_of_english: Can we have a guarantee that there will be no slacking off in the married quarters programme?
The fact is that we are slacking now.
Great schemes have been undertaken resulting in intense activity for a short time, and then there has been a slacking off resulting in unemployment.
After 1880 immigration slacked off and growth was due chiefly to the excess of births over deaths.
His personality was that of a humorous, extroverted, immature slacker.
He had on a white shirt and a pair of gray slacks.
During the week the girls wear a navy pleated skirt, white middy blouse, and tie, while boys wear khaki slacks and a white polo shirt.
I do not want to say that they are all idling and slacking; that would be wicked, and it would be untrue.
